channel.title: Loading Spirit
channel.description:
I don't know if it's the right section to post this, anyway i'm going to post it here :P
I have problem with auto cache loading/downloading, When i open my client automatically the cache will start loading but it doesn't show this spirit that " Cache downloading/Loading " All i can see is black screen, While the cache is loading with this black screen.
Anyone knows how i can fix this?

item.title: Loading Spirit

item.description:
@Naseem wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:518808”]hmm actually remove both of those super.drawLoadingText(i, s);

and let me know if that fixes the issue

As far as I know the super.drawLoadingText was used in an earlier login box I believe?[/quote]

Didn’t work, which i still have the same problem…

[hr]

Anyone can help me to fix this?

Read full topic

item.title: Loading Spirit
item.dc:creator: @Naseem Naseem
item.description:
@Naseem wrote:

Loveandpower:

You mean the loading bar?

Yes

Togasa:

You mean ‘Sprite’? tee hee :X

I don’t know if the problem because the sprite

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:518808”]the problem most likely lies in:

Where i can find that exactly?

Can you help me out

void drawLoadingText(int i, String s)
    {
       	anInt1079 = i;
		super.drawLoadingText(i, s);
		aString1049 = s;
		resetImageProducers();
		if(titleStreamLoader == null) {
	super.drawLoadingText(i, s);
			return;
		}
        	aRSImageProducer_1109.initDrawingArea();		
			loadingBarEmpty = new Sprite("Login/Empty");
			loadingBarFull = new Sprite("Login/Full");
			char c = '\u0168';
			char c1 = '\310';
			byte byte1 = 20;
			int j = c1 / 2 - 18 - byte1;
			loadingBarEmpty.drawSprite(220, 9);
			loadingBarFull.drawSprite(286, 31);
			DrawingArea.drawPixels(13, 31, (286 + i), 0x302e2c, (194 - i));
			if (i == 194) {
				smallText.drawText(0xffffff, s + " - 100%", 28, 385);
			} else {
				smallText.drawText(0xffffff, s + " - " + (i/2) + "%", 28, 385);
			}
        			aRSImageProducer_1109.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 0);
			if(welcomeScreenRaised) {
				welcomeScreenRaised = false;
			}
		}

Read full topic
